content: Ebola virus disease (Ebola, or EVD) is a severe, often fatal disease first detected in the Democratic Republic of the Congo in 1976. It is spread through contact with infected bodily fluids and is not transmitted through the air. An outbreak in Guinea, West Africa in March 2014 is the largest and most persistent ever documented. The Ebola outbreak in Guinea, West Africa is the largest and most persistent ever documented.
